newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly up.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly up.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Friday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
The central bank does not post volumes.

Traders said some major financial institutions were net borrowers today because they underwrote part of the 20 billion yuan worth of new seven-year treasury bonds and needed short-term money. Issue of the bonds began today.
Trading was more active than on Thursday, he added.

"The new seven-year bond issue which will last for 20 days had some impact on the market," one trader said. "Major institutions increased their borrowing today due to the issue, pushing up the rates and trading volume."
Traders said the rates were likely to move in a narrow range early next week. -- Shanghai newsroom (86-21) 6279-7004
